meanings.definition: Predict or prophesy a future event.
meanings.sent1: Grandma can foretell the weather by looking at the sky.
meanings.sent2: The fortune teller claimed to foretell the winner of the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to foretell when the treat bag would open.
meanings.sent4: The ancient book seemed to foretell the rise of a great leader.
meanings.sent5: The old tree's growth rings seemed to foretell many years of drought.

meanings.definition: Indicate or warn of something in advance.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds foretell a storm coming our way.
meanings.sent2: The sudden drop in temperature could foretell the start of winter.
meanings.sent3: The loud thunder seemed to foretell a surprise party instead.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the forest foretold danger lurking nearby.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's frown seemed to foretell a pop quiz for the class.
